00047 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00048 
00049 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00050 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00051 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00052 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00053 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00054 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00055 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00056 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00057 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00058 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)

00060 typedef unsigned long xnlock_t;
00061 
00062 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED 0
00063 
00064 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00065 
00066 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00067 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00068 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00069 
00070 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00071 
00072     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00073 }
00074 
00075 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00076 
00077 {
00078     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00079     spl_t flags;
00080 
00081     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00082 
00083     adeos_load_cpuid();
00084 
00085     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,lock))
00086         {
00087         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock))
00088             /* Use a non-locking test in the inner loop, as Linux'es
00089                bit_spin_lock. */
00090             while (test_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1, lock))
00091                 cpu_relax();
00092         }
00093     else
00094         flags |= 2;
00095 
00096     return flags;
00097 }
00098 
00099 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00100 
00101 {
00102     if (!(flags & 2))
00103         {
00104         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00105 
00106         rthal_cli();
00107 
00108         adeos_load_cpuid();
00109 
00110         if (test_bit(cpuid,lock))
00111             {
00112             clear_bit(cpuid,lock);
00113             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock);
00114             }
00115         }
00116 
00117     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00118 }
00119 
00120 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS /*empty*/
00121 
00122 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00123 
00124 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00125 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00126 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00127 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00128 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00129 
00130 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00183 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00184 
00185     /* Kernel mode side */
00186 
00187 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00188     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00189        and SPE are not available to kernel-based nucleus threads. */
00190     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00191     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00192     struct task_struct *user_fpu_owner;
00193     /* Pointer the the FPU owner in userspace:
00194        - NULL for RT K threads,
00195        - last_task_used_math for Linux US threads (only current or NULL when MP)
00196        - current for RT US threads.
00197     */
00198 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00199 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00200 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00201 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00202 
00203     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00204     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00205     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00206     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00207 
00208     /* User mode side */
00209     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00210     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00211 
00212     /* Init block */
00213     struct xnthread *self;
00214     int imask;
00215     const char *name;
00216     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00217     void *cookie;
00218 
00219 } xnarchtcb_t;

00245 static inline long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (long long ts) {
00246     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00247 }
00248 
00249 static inline long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (long long ns) {
00250     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00251 }
00252 
00253 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00254     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00255 }

00258     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00259 }

00262     return adeos_processor_id();

00265 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00266 
00267 {
00268 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00269     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00270         return vmalloc(bytes);
00271 #endif
00272 
00273     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00274 }
00275 
00276 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00277 
00278 {
00279 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00280     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00281         vfree(chunk);
00282     else
00283 #endif
00284         kfree(chunk);
00285 }

00292 do { \
00293     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00294     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00295     show_stack(NULL,NULL);              \
00296     for (;;) ;                          \
00297 } while(0)

00302 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00303 
00304 {
00305     spl_t s;
00306     splhigh(s);
00307     splexit(!!imask);
00308     return !!s;
00309 }

00370 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00371 
00372 {
00373     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00374 
00375     adeos_load_cpuid();
00376 
00377     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00378        and always inside a critical section. */
00379     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00380     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00381     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00382 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00383     rootcb->user_fpu_owner = rthal_get_fpu_owner(rootcb->user_task);
00384     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00385     rootcb->fpup = (rootcb->user_fpu_owner
00386                     ? (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.fpr[0]
00387                     : NULL);
00388 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00389 }
00390 
00391 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00392     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00393 }
00394 
00395 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00396                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00397 {
00398     struct task_struct *prev = out_tcb->active_task;
00399     struct task_struct *next = in_tcb->user_task;
00400 
00401     in_tcb->active_task = next ?: prev;
00402 
00403     if (next && next != prev) /* Switch to new user-space thread? */
00404         {
00405         struct mm_struct *mm = next->active_mm;
00406 
00407         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00408 
00409 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00410         /* Don't rely on FTR fixups --
00411            they don't work properly in our context. */
00412         if (cur_cpu_spec[0]->cpu_features & CPU_FTR_ALTIVEC) {
00413             asm volatile (
00414                 "dssall;\n"
00415 #ifndef CONFIG_POWER4
00416                 "sync;\n"
00417 #endif
00418                 : : );
00419         }
00420 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00421 
00422         next->thread.pgdir = mm->pgd;
00423         get_mmu_context(mm);
00424         set_context(mm->context,mm->pgd);
00425 
00426         /* _switch expects a valid "current" (r2) for storing
00427          * ALTIVEC and SPE state. */
00428         current = prev;
00429         _switch(&prev->thread, &next->thread);
00430 
00431         barrier();
00432         }
00433     else
00434         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00435         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00436 }
00437 
00438 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00439                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00440 {
00441     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00442 }
00443 
00444 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00445 
00446 {
00447     /* Empty */
00448 }
00449 
00450 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00451                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00452                                          const char *name)
00453 {
00454     tcb->user_task = current;
00455     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00456     tcb->ksp = 0;
00457     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00458 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00459     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00460     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00461 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00462     tcb->entry = NULL;
00463     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00464     tcb->self = thread;
00465     tcb->imask = 0;
00466     tcb->name = name;
00467 }
00468 
00469 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00470 
00471 {
00472     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00473     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00474     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00475     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00476 }
00477 
00478 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00479                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00480                                        void *cookie,
00481                                        int imask,
00482                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00483                                        char *name)
00484 {
00485     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00486 
00487     adeos_hw_local_irq_flags(flags);
00488 
00489     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00490     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf) - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00491     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00492     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00493     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00494     ksp[26] = flags & ~(MSR_EE | MSR_FP); /* msr */
00495 
00496     tcb->entry = entry;
00497     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00498     tcb->self = thread;
00499     tcb->imask = imask;
00500     tcb->name = name;
00501 }
00502 
00503 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *current_tcb)
00504 
00505 {
00506 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00507     if(!current_tcb->user_task)
00508         rthal_enable_fpu();
00509 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00510 }
00511 
00512 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00513 
00514 {
00515 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00516     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00517        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00518     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00519     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00520 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00521 }
00522 
00523 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00524 
00525 {
00526 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00527 
00528     if(tcb->fpup)
00529         {
00530         rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00531 
00532         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00533             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr &= ~MSR_FP;
00534         }   
00535 
00536 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00537 }
00538 
00539 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00540 
00541 {
00542 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00543 
00544     if(tcb->fpup)
00545         {
00546         rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00547 
00548         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00549             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_FP;
00550         }   
00551 
00552     /* FIXME: We restore FPU "as it was" when RTAI preempted Linux, whereas we
00553        could be much lazier. */
00554     if(tcb->user_task)
00555         rthal_disable_fpu();
00556 
00557 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00558 }

00566 
00567 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00568 
00569 {
00570     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00571                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00572                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00573                                      NULL,
00574                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00575 }
00576 
00577 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00578 
00579 {
00580     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00581                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00582                                      NULL,
00583                                      NULL,
00584                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00585 }

00592 }

00594 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */

00617 
00618 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00619 
00620 {
00621 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00622     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00623        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00624     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00625 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00626 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00627     xnshadow_release_events();
00628 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00629     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00630     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00631     schedule_timeout(50);
00632     xnarch_release_ipi();
00633 }
00634 
00635 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00636 
00637 {
00638     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00639 
00640     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00641         {
00642         spl_t s;
00643         splsync(s);
00644         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00645         splexit(s);
00646         return 1;
00647         }
00648 
00649     return 0;
00650 }
00651 
00652 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00653 
00654 {
00655 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00656     xnshadow_grab_events();
00657 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00658 }
00659 
00660 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00661 
00662 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00663 
00664 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00665 
00666     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00667     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00668     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00669 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00670     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00671     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00672 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00673     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00674 }
00675 
00676 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00677 
00678 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00679 
00680 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00681                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00682                                            const char *name)
00683 {
00684     struct task_struct *task = current;
00685 
00686     tcb->user_task = task;
00687     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00688     tcb->ksp = 0;
00689     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00690 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00691     tcb->user_fpu_owner = task;
00692     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00693 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00694     tcb->entry = NULL;
00695     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00696     tcb->self = thread;
00697     tcb->imask = 0;
00698     tcb->name = name;
00699 }
00700 
00701 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00702 
00703 {
00704     unsigned irq;
00705 
00706     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00707         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00708                              handler,
00709                              NULL,
00710                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00711 
00712     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00713        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00714        individually. */
00715 
00716     adeos_virtualize_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ,
00717                          handler,
00718                          NULL,
00719                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00720 }
00721 
00722 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00723 
00724 {
00725     unsigned irq;
00726 
00727     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00728         {
00729         switch (irq)
00730             {
00731 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00732             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00733 
00734                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00735                 continue;
00736 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00737 
00738             default:
00739 
00740                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00741             }
00742         }
00743 
00744     __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00745 }
00746 
00747 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00748 
00749 {
00750     unsigned irq;
00751 
00752     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00753         {
00754         switch (irq)
00755             {
00756 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00757             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00758 
00759                 continue;
00760 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00761 
00762             default:
00763 
00764                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00765             }
00766         }
00767 
00768     __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00769 }
00770 
00771 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00772 
00773 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00774 
00775 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00776     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00777        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00778        for now. If a timer needs more, a spurious but harmless call to
00779        the tick handler will occur after 4 billions ticks. Since the
00780        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00781        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */
00782     rthal_set_timer_shot(delay);
00783 }
00784 
00785 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00786     rthal_release_timer();
00787 }
00788 
00789 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00790 
00791 {
00792 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00793     return -1;          /* FIXME */
00794 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00795     return 0;
00796 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00797 }
00798 
00799 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00800                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00801                                         unsigned long long defval)
00802 {
00803 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00804     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00805     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00806     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00807 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00808     *shot = defval;
00809     *delivery = defval;
00810 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00811 }
00812 
00813 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00817 #include <linux/mm.h>

00820 
00821 {
00822     atomic_set(&hcb->numaps,0);
00823     hcb->kmflags = 0;
00824     hcb->heapbase = NULL;
00825 }

00827 static inline int xnarch_remap_page_range(struct vm_area_struct *vma,
00828                                           unsigned long uvaddr,
00829                                           unsigned long paddr,
00830                                           unsigned long size,
00831                                           pgprot_t prot)
00832 {
00833     return remap_pfn_range(vma,uvaddr,paddr >> PAGE_SHIFT,size,prot);
00834 }

00836 #endif /* XENO_HEAP_MODULE */
00837 
00838 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00839 
00840 #include <linux/init.h>
00841 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00842 
00843 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00844 
00845 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00846 
00847 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00848 
00849 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00850 
00851 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00852 
00853 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00854 
00855 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00856 
00857 {
00858     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00859     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00860     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00861 }
00862 
00863 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00864 
00865 {
00866 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00867     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00868 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00869     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00870        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00871     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer()) ?: 1;
00872 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00873 }
00874 
00875 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00876 
00877 {
00878     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00879 
00880     if (!nktimerlat)
00881         return -ENODEV;
00882 
00883     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00884 
00885     return 0;
00886 }
00887 
00888 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00889 
00890 {
00891     int err;
00892 
00893 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00894     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00895        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00896     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00897 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00898 
00899     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00900 
00901     if (err)
00902         return err;
00903 
00904     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00905 
00906     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00907         return -ENOSYS;
00908 
00909     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00910                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00911                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00912                               NULL,
00913                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00914 
00915     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00916 
00917 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00918     err = xnshadow_mount();
00919 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00920 
00921     if (err)
00922         {
00923         rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00924         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00925         }
00926 
00927     return err;
00928 }
00929 
00930 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00931 
00932 {
00933 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00934     xnshadow_cleanup();
00935 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00936     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00937     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00938 }
00939 
00940 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00941 
00942 #ifdef __cplusplus
00943 }
00944 #endif

00952 #define xnarch_post_graph_if(obj,state,cond)
